issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

fields.summary: Ability to Change Load Balancer Sub Domain Needs To Be Added to DNS Section

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
*Assessment*

After deploying a load balancer on Eucalyptus 3.4 with Eucalyptus DNS enabled, I was not able to resolve the DNS name of the load balancer.  Here is an nslookup against the CLC:

{code}
$ nslookup Jamaica-735723906303.lb.euca-hspencer.eucalyptus-systems.com 10.104.10.6
;; Warning: query response not set
Server:		10.104.10.6
Address:	10.104.10.6#53

** server can't find Jamaica-735723906303.lb.euca-hspencer.eucalyptus-systems.com.prc.eucalyptus-systems.com: SERVFAIL
{code}

*Signs*

Here is the cloud properties information for DNS:
{code}
# euca-describe-properties | grep dns
PROPERTY	bootstrap.webservices.use_dns_delegation	true
PROPERTY	bootstrap.webservices.use_instance_dns	true
PROPERTY	experimental.dns.enabled	true
PROPERTY	experimental.dns.instancedata.enabled	true
PROPERTY	experimental.dns.ns.enabled	true
PROPERTY	experimental.dns.recursive.enabled	true
PROPERTY	experimental.dns.services.enabled	true
PROPERTY	experimental.dns.split_horizon.enabled	true
PROPERTY	experimental.dns.spoof_regions.enabled	true
PROPERTY	experimental.dns.spoof_regions.region_name	{}
PROPERTY	experimental.dns.spoof_regions.spoof_aws_default_regions	true
PROPERTY	experimental.dns.spoof_regions.spoof_aws_regions	false
PROPERTY	loadbalancing.loadbalancer_dns_subdomain	lb
PROPERTY	system.dns.dnsdomain	euca-hspencer.eucalyptus-systems.com
PROPERTY	system.dns.nameserver	nshost.localhost
PROPERTY	system.dns.nameserveraddress	8.8.8.8
PROPERTY	system.dns.registrationid	42bf49fb-feed-4b3d-858e-c95f2ea20c41
PROPERTY	walrus.bucketnamesrequirednscompliance	false
{code}

Here is the lookup being logged in the cloud-output.log/cloud-debug.log files:
{code}
# grep Jamaica /var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-* | grep -i DnsResolvers
/var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-debug.log:Tue Nov 5 11:20:40 2013 DEBUG [DnsResolvers:Thread-41] [com.eucalyptus.util.dns.DnsResolvers.findRecords(DnsResolvers.java):511] DnsResolvers.findRecords(): resolvers for Jamaica-735723906303.lb.euca-hspencer.eucalyptus-systems.com. are: []
/var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-debug.log:Tue Nov 5 11:20:41 2013 DEBUG [DnsResolvers:Thread-41] [com.eucalyptus.util.dns.DnsResolvers.findRecords(DnsResolvers.java):511] DnsResolvers.findRecords(): resolvers for Jamaica-735723906303.lb.euca-hspencer.eucalyptus-systems.com.prc.eucalyptus-systems.com. are: [RecursiveDnsResolver]
/var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-debug.log:Tue Nov 5 11:20:41 2013 DEBUG [DnsResolvers:Thread-41] [com.eucalyptus.util.dns.DnsResolvers.lookupRecords(DnsResolvers.java):446] DnsResolver: A Jamaica-735723906303.lb.euca-hspencer.eucalyptus-systems.com.prc.eucalyptus-systems.com.
/var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-output.log.1:2013-11-05 11:20:40 DEBUG 000000811 DnsResolvers             | DnsResolvers.findRecords(): resolvers for Jamaica-735723906303.lb.euca-hspencer.eucalyptus-systems.com. are: []
/var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-output.log.1:2013-11-05 11:20:41 DEBUG 000000811 DnsResolvers             | DnsResolvers.findRecords(): resolvers for Jamaica-735723906303.lb.euca-hspencer.eucalyptus-systems.com.prc.eucalyptus-systems.com. are: [RecursiveDnsResolver]
/var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-output.log.1:2013-11-05 11:20:41 DEBUG 000000811 DnsResolvers             | DnsResolver: A Jamaica-735723906303.lb.euca-hspencer.eucalyptus-systems.com.prc.eucalyptus-systems.com.
{code}

Here is a dig being performed against the CLC for the load balancer:
{code}
$ dig Jamaica-735723906303.lb.euca-hspencer.eucalyptus-systems.com @10.104.10.6

; <<>> DiG 9.8.2rc1-RedHat-9.8.2-0.17.rc1.el6_4.6 <<>> Jamaica-735723906303.lb.euca-hspencer.eucalyptus-systems.com @10.104.10.6
;; global options: +cmd
;; Got answer:
;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: NXDOMAIN, id: 25324
;; flags: qr aa rd; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 0, AUTHORITY: 1, ADDITIONAL: 0
;; WARNING: recursion requested but not available

;; QUESTION SECTION:
;Jamaica-735723906303.lb.euca-hspencer.eucalyptus-systems.com. IN A

;; AUTHORITY SECTION:
euca-hspencer.eucalyptus-systems.com. 604800 IN	SOA root.euca-hspencer.eucalyptus-systems.com. odc-c-06.prc.eucalyptus-systems.com.euca-hspencer.eucalyptus-systems.com. 1 86400 604800 2419200 600

;; Query time: 146 msec
;; SERVER: 10.104.10.6#53(10.104.10.6)
;; WHEN: Tue Nov  5 11:31:50 2013
;; MSG SIZE  rcvd: 155
{code}

Other instances are running on the cloud, and they resolve just fine:
{code}
$ nslookup euca-10-104-7-22.eucalyptus.euca-hspencer.eucalyptus-systems.com 10.104.10.6
Server:		10.104.10.6
Address:	10.104.10.6#53

Name:	euca-10-104-7-22.eucalyptus.euca-hspencer.eucalyptus-systems.com
Address: 10.104.7.22

$ dig euca-10-104-7-22.eucalyptus.euca-hspencer.eucalyptus-systems.com @10.104.10.6

; <<>> DiG 9.8.2rc1-RedHat-9.8.2-0.17.rc1.el6_4.6 <<>> euca-10-104-7-22.eucalyptus.euca-hspencer.eucalyptus-systems.com @10.104.10.6
;; global options: +cmd
;; Got answer:
;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: NOERROR, id: 5292
;; flags: qr aa rd ra; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 1, AUTHORITY: 0, ADDITIONAL: 0

;; QUESTION SECTION:
;euca-10-104-7-22.eucalyptus.euca-hspencer.eucalyptus-systems.com. IN A

;; ANSWER SECTION:
euca-10-104-7-22.eucalyptus.euca-hspencer.eucalyptus-systems.com. 60 IN	A 10.104.7.22

;; Query time: 219 msec
;; SERVER: 10.104.10.6#53(10.104.10.6)
;; WHEN: Tue Nov  5 11:33:00 2013
;; MSG SIZE  rcvd: 98
{code}

Whats also interesting is that you can resolve the DNS name of the ELB instance, but not the DNS name returned for the Load Balancer:
{code}
# euca-describe-instances --region eucalyptus-admin@
RESERVATION	r-2A644498	407837561996	euca-internal-735723906303-Jamaica
INSTANCE	i-66684547	emi-F4763190	euca-10-104-7-21.eucalyptus.euca-hspencer.eucalyptus-systems.com	euca-172-17-187-73.eucalyptus.internal	running		0		m1.small	2013-11-05T19:20:31.401Z	Exodus	eki-54CD3744	eri-C66835FE		monitoring-enabled	10.104.7.21	172.17.187.73			instance-store					paravirtualized		d0914750-8ebf-4027-8c31-c44ee21505f5_Exodus_1				arn:aws:iam::407837561996:instance-profile/internal/loadbalancer/loadbalancer-vm
TAG	instance	i-66684547	Name	loadbalancer-resources
TAG	instance	i-66684547	aws:autoscaling:groupName	asg-euca-internal-elb-735723906303-Jamaica
TAG	instance	i-66684547	euca:node	10.105.10.11
$ nslookup euca-10-104-7-21.eucalyptus.euca-hspencer.eucalyptus-systems.com 10.104.10.6
Server:		10.104.10.6
Address:	10.104.10.6#53

Name:	euca-10-104-7-21.eucalyptus.euca-hspencer.eucalyptus-systems.com
Address: 10.104.7.21
{code}

*Steps*

* Set up a Eucalyptus 3.4 cloud, non-HA, multi-cluster
{code}
# rpm -qa | grep eucalyptus
eucalyptus-sos-plugins-0.1.3-1.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-admin-tools-3.4.0-0.0.1592.20131004git8aa607bc.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-walrus-3.4.0-0.0.1592.20131004git8aa607bc.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-3.4.0-0.0.1592.20131004git8aa607bc.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-common-java-3.4.0-0.0.1592.20131004git8aa607bc.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-cloud-3.4.0-0.0.1592.20131004git8aa607bc.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-load-balancer-image-1.0.2-0.127.131002git65fc4e1.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-common-java-libs-3.4.0-0.0.1592.20131004git8aa607bc.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-enterprise-storage-san-equallogic-libs-3.4.0-0.0.1525.20131003git8600d52c.el6.x86_64
{code}
* Enable Eucalyptus DNS
* Launch an ELB
* Attempt to do a dig, or nslookup to resolve the ELB.

*Pertinent Data*

Because this doesn't resolve correctly, how are users suppose to use ELB with Eucalyptus DNS.

*Workaround*

N/A
fields.summary: DNS resolution for Load Balancer Fails
fields.environment:
*non-HA, multi-cluster*
** 1 x CLC/Walrus
** 2 x CC/SC (one CC/SC per cluster)
** 2 x NCs (one NC per cluster)
{code}
# euca-describe-services
SERVICE	autoscaling    	autoscaling    	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	32  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/AutoScaling	arn:euca:eucalyptus:autoscaling:autoscaling:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	eucalyptus     	eucalyptus     	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	32  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Eucalyptus	arn:euca:eucalyptus:::10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	jetty          	eucalyptus     	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	32  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Jetty  	arn:euca:eucalyptus::jetty:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	euare          	eucalyptus     	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	32  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Euare  	arn:euca:eucalyptus::euare:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	bootstrap      	bootstrap      	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	32  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Empyrean	arn:euca:bootstrap:::10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	cluster        	Exodus         	NaturalMystic  	ENABLED   	32  	http://10.104.10.22:8774/axis2/services/EucalyptusCC	arn:euca:eucalyptus:Exodus:cluster:NaturalMystic/
SERVICE	cluster        	Legend         	IsThisLove     	ENABLED   	32  	http://10.104.1.185:8774/axis2/services/EucalyptusCC	arn:euca:eucalyptus:Legend:cluster:IsThisLove/
SERVICE	walrus         	walrus         	StirItUp       	ENABLED   	32  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Walrus 	arn:euca:bootstrap:walrus:walrus:StirItUp/
SERVICE	loadbalancing  	loadbalancing  	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	32  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/LoadBalancing	arn:euca:eucalyptus:loadbalancing:loadbalancing:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	cloudwatch     	cloudwatch     	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	32  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/CloudWatch	arn:euca:eucalyptus:cloudwatch:cloudwatch:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	reporting      	bootstrap      	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	32  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Reporting	arn:euca:bootstrap::reporting:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	tokens         	eucalyptus     	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	32  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Tokens 	arn:euca:eucalyptus::tokens:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	dns            	eucalyptus     	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	32  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Dns    	arn:euca:eucalyptus::dns:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	storage        	Exodus         	TheHeathen     	ENABLED   	32  	http://10.104.10.22:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:Exodus:storage:TheHeathen/
SERVICE	storage        	Legend         	NoWomanNoCry   	ENABLED   	32  	http://10.104.1.185:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:Legend:storage:NoWomanNoCry/
SERVICE	notifications  	eucalyptus     	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	32  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Notifications	arn:euca:eucalyptus::notifications:10.104.10.6/
{code}

comments.body:
I tried on another 3.4 setup (this was an upgrade from 3.3.2) and it worked.  Does this have to do with the packages that I am using?:

{code}
$ euca-describe-properties | grep dns
PROPERTY	bootstrap.webservices.use_dns_delegation	true
PROPERTY	bootstrap.webservices.use_instance_dns	true
PROPERTY	dns.enabled	true
PROPERTY	dns.instancedata.enabled	true
PROPERTY	dns.ns.enabled	true
PROPERTY	dns.recursive.enabled	true
PROPERTY	dns.services.enabled	true
PROPERTY	dns.split_horizon.enabled	true
PROPERTY	dns.spoof_regions.enabled	true
PROPERTY	dns.spoof_regions.region_name	{}
PROPERTY	dns.spoof_regions.spoof_aws_default_regions	true
PROPERTY	dns.spoof_regions.spoof_aws_regions	false
PROPERTY	loadbalancing.loadbalancer_dns_subdomain	lb
PROPERTY	system.dns.dnsdomain	euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com
PROPERTY	system.dns.nameserver	nshost.localhost
PROPERTY	system.dns.nameserveraddress	8.8.8.8
PROPERTY	system.dns.registrationid	04de74e9-e70e-4a2a-84ba-302765f7d651
PROPERTY	walrus.bucketnamesrequirednscompliance	false

$ rpm -qa | grep eucalyptus
eucalyptus-common-java-3.4.0-0.0.1654.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-walrus-3.4.0-0.0.1654.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-3.4.0-0.0.1654.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-common-java-libs-3.4.0-0.0.1654.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-cloud-3.4.0-0.0.1654.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-load-balancer-image-1.0.2-0.138.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-release-3.4-1.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-admin-tools-3.4.0-0.0.1654.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-console-3.4.0-0.0.2835.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-sos-plugins-0.1.3-1.el6.noarch

$ eulb-create-lb -z LayinDaSmackDown -l "lb-port=80, protocol=HTTP, instance-port=80, instance-protocol=HTTP" ProjectPat --region account1-user01@
DNS_NAME	ProjectPat-961915002812.lb.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com

$ euca-describe-instances --region admin@
RESERVATION	r-F50240DD	441445882805	euca-internal-961915002812-ProjectPat
INSTANCE	i-0CA43F49	emi-B41335F3	euca-10-104-7-10.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com	euca-172-17-119-188.eucalyptus.internal	running		0		m1.small	2013-11-05T20:34:35.371Z	LayinDaSmackDown	eki-71583A4F	eri-DD0D37F3		monitoring-enabled	10.104.7.10	172.17.119.188			instance-store					paravirtualized		405827be-9edc-436b-b4ff-8c808924a7ea_LayinDaSmackDown_1				arn:aws:iam::441445882805:instance-profile/internal/loadbalancer/loadbalancer-vm
TAG	instance	i-0CA43F49	Name	loadbalancer-resources
TAG	instance	i-0CA43F49	aws:autoscaling:groupName	asg-euca-internal-elb-961915002812-ProjectPat
TAG	instance	i-0CA43F49	euca:node	node1

$ nslookup ProjectPat-961915002812.lb.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com
Server:		10.1.1.254
Address:	10.1.1.254#53

Non-authoritative answer:
Name:	ProjectPat-961915002812.lb.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com
Address: 10.104.7.10
{code}
This should be no longer reproducible as ELB test is part of daily QA.
[~spark], it is the case that the name is not resolvable until there are instances registered with the load balancer?
[~sjones] Yes that is a possible explanation.
